00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the hardware Free Pool Allocator on Octeon chips.
00044  * These are the legacy models, i.e. prior to CN78XX/CN76XX.
00045  *
00046  * <hr>$Revision: 120123 $<hr>
00047  *
00048  */
00049 
00050 
00051 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00052 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-scratch.h>
00053 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-fpa-defs.h>
00054 #else
00055 #include "cvmx-scratch.h"
00056 #include "cvmx-fpa-defs.h"
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #ifndef __CVMX_FPA1_HW_H__
00060 #define __CVMX_FPA1_HW_H__
00061 
00062 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00063 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00064 extern "C" {
00065 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 /* Legacy pool range is 0..7 and 8 on CN68XX */
00069 typedef int cvmx_fpa1_pool_t;
00070 #define CVMX_FPA1_NUM_POOLS      8
00071 #define CVMX_FPA1_INVALID_POOL ((cvmx_fpa1_pool_t)-1)
00072 #define CVMX_FPA1_NAME_SIZE 16
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * Structure describing the data format used for stores to the FPA.
00076  */
00077 typedef union {
00078     uint64_t u64;
00079     struct {
00080         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t scraddr:8, /**
00081                      * the (64-bit word) location in
00082                      * scratchpad to write to (if len != 0)
00083                      */
00084         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t len:8,     /**
00085                      * the number of words in the response
00086                      * (0 => no response)
00087                      */
00088         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t did:8,     /**
00089                      * the ID of the device on the
00090                      * non-coherent bus
00091                      */
00092         CVMX_BITFIELD_FIELD(uint64_t addr:40,   /**
00093                      * the address that will appear in the
00094                      * first tick on the NCB bus
00095                      */
00096         ))));
00097     } s;
00098 } cvmx_fpa1_iobdma_data_t;
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * Allocate or reserve the specified fpa pool.
00102  *
00103  * @param pool    FPA pool to allocate/reserve. If -1 it
00104  *                finds an empty pool to allocate.
00105  * @return        Alloctaed pool number or CVMX_FPA1_POOL_INVALID
00106  *                if fails to allocate the pool
00107  */
00108 cvmx_fpa1_pool_t cvmx_fpa1_reserve_pool(cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * Free the specified fpa pool.
00112  * @param pool     Pool to free
00113  * @return         0 for success -1 failure
00114  */
00115 int cvmx_fpa1_release_pool(cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool);
00116 
00117 static inline void cvmx_fpa1_free(void *ptr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool,
00118     uint64_t num_cache_lines)
00119 {
00120     cvmx_addr_t newptr;
00121 
00122     newptr.u64 = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(ptr);
00123     newptr.sfilldidspace.didspace =
00124         CVMX_ADDR_DIDSPACE(CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_FPA, pool));
00125     /* Make sure that any previous writes to memory go out before we free
00126      * this buffer.  This also serves as a barrier to prevent GCC from
00127      * reordering operations to after the free.
00128      */
00129     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00130     /* value written is number of cache lines not written back */
00131     cvmx_write_io(newptr.u64, num_cache_lines);
00132 }
00133 
00134 static inline void cvmx_fpa1_free_nosync(void *ptr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool,
00135                     unsigned num_cache_lines)
00136 {
00137     cvmx_addr_t newptr;
00138     newptr.u64 = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(ptr);
00139     newptr.sfilldidspace.didspace =
00140         CVMX_ADDR_DIDSPACE(CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_FPA, pool));
00141     /* Prevent GCC from reordering around free */
00142     asm volatile ("" : : : "memory");
00143     /* value written is number of cache lines not written back */
00144     cvmx_write_io(newptr.u64, num_cache_lines);
00145 }
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * Enable the FPA for use. Must be performed after any CSR
00149  * configuration but before any other FPA functions.
00150  */
00151 static inline void cvmx_fpa1_enable(void)
00152 {
00153     cvmx_fpa_ctl_status_t status;
00154 
00155     status.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_FPA_CTL_STATUS);
00156     if (status.s.enb) {
00157         /*
00158          * CN68XXP1 should not reset the FPA (doing so may break
00159          * the SSO, so we may end up enabling it more than once.
00160          * Just return and don't spew messages.
00161          */
00162         return;
00163     }
00164 
00165     status.u64 = 0;
00166     status.s.enb = 1;
00167     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_FPA_CTL_STATUS, status.u64);
00168 }
00169 
00170 /**
00171  * Reset FPA to disable. Make sure buffers from all FPA pools are freed
00172  * before disabling FPA.
00173  */
00174 static inline void cvmx_fpa1_disable(void)
00175 {
00176     cvmx_fpa_ctl_status_t status;
00177 
00178     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX_PASS1))
00179         return;
00180 
00181     status.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_FPA_CTL_STATUS);
00182     status.s.reset = 1;
00183     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_FPA_CTL_STATUS, status.u64);
00184 }
00185 
00186 
00187 static inline void *cvmx_fpa1_alloc(cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool)
00188 {
00189     uint64_t address;
00190 
00191     for (;;) {
00192         address = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_ADDR_DID(CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_FPA,
00193                     pool)));
00194         if (cvmx_likely(address)) {
00195             return cvmx_phys_to_ptr(address);
00196         } else {
00197             if (cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_FPA_QUEX_AVAILABLE(pool)) > 0)
00198                 cvmx_wait(50);
00199             else
00200                 return NULL;
00201         }
00202     }
00203 }
00204 
00205 /**
00206  * Asynchronously get a new block from the FPA
00207  * @INTERNAL
00208  *
00209  * The result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc() may be retrieved using
00210  * cvmx_fpa_async_alloc_finish().
00211  *
00212  * @param scr_addr Local scratch address to put response in.  This is a byte
00213  *         address but must be 8 byte aligned.
00214  * @param pool      Pool to get the block from
00215  */
00216 static inline void
00217 cvmx_fpa1_async_alloc(uint64_t scr_addr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool)
00218 {
00219     cvmx_fpa1_iobdma_data_t data;
00220 
00221     /* Hardware only uses 64 bit aligned locations, so convert from byte
00222      * address to 64-bit index
00223      */
00224     data.u64 = 0ull;
00225     data.s.scraddr = scr_addr >> 3;
00226     data.s.len = 1;
00227     data.s.did = CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_FPA, pool);
00228     data.s.addr = 0;
00229 
00230     cvmx_scratch_write64(scr_addr, 0ull);
00231     CVMX_SYNCW;
00232     cvmx_send_single(data.u64);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /**
00236  * Retrieve the result of cvmx_fpa_async_alloc
00237  * @INTERNAL
00238  *
00239  * @param scr_addr The Local scratch address.  Must be the same value
00240  * passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc().
00241  *
00242  * @param pool Pool the block came from.  Must be the same value
00243  * passed to cvmx_fpa_async_alloc.
00244  *
00245  * @return Pointer to the block or NULL on failure
00246  */
00247 static inline void *
00248 cvmx_fpa1_async_alloc_finish(uint64_t scr_addr, cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool)
00249 {
00250     uint64_t address;
00251 
00252     CVMX_SYNCIOBDMA;
00253 
00254     address = cvmx_scratch_read64(scr_addr);
00255     if (cvmx_likely(address))
00256         return cvmx_phys_to_ptr(address);
00257     else
00258         return cvmx_fpa1_alloc(pool);
00259 }
00260 
00261 
00262 static inline uint64_t cvmx_fpa1_get_available(cvmx_fpa1_pool_t pool)
00263 {
00264     return cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_FPA_QUEX_AVAILABLE(pool));
00265 }

00268 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00269 }
00270 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00271 #endif
